questions.question: What is the purpose of the Entity-Relationship (ER) model in database design?
options: To provide a conceptual design for database schema
questions.answer: To provide a conceptual design for database schema

questions.question: Which of the following represents an entity in an ER diagram?
What is the difference between an entity and an attribute?
options: Entities represent objects, attributes are facts about entities
Entities are always nouns, attributes are always verbs
Entities are properties, attributes are relationships
Entities and attributes are interchangeable in ER diagrams
questions.answer: Entities represent objects, attributes are facts about entities

questions.question: What type of relationship exists when each lecturer tutors multiple students, but each student has only one tutor?
How are attributes represented in an ER diagram?
What is a cardinality ratio in a relationship?
options: The maximum number of entities involved in the relationship
The number of attributes in an entity
The degree to which an attribute is linked to an entity
The number of instances of an entity involved in a relationship
questions.answer: The maximum number of entities involved in the relationship

questions.question: What is a ternary relationship in an ER diagram?
How can a many-to-many (M:M) relationship be resolved in an ER diagram?
options: By merging entities involved in the relationship
By creating two one-to-many relationships and an intermediate entity
questions.answer: By creating two one-to-many relationships and an intermediate entity

questions.question: In the ER model, what determines whether 'address' should be an entity or an attribute?
options: The complexity and semantics of the data
The number of relationships it has
questions.answer: The complexity and semantics of the data

questions.question: What is an example of a redundant one-to-one relationship?
options: A product linked to its supplier
A supplier linked to its unique address
A module linked to its lecturer
A student linked to multiple courses
questions.answer: A supplier linked to its unique address

questions.question: What are the general guidelines for identifying entities in a textual description?
options: They are always verbs in the description
They are often nouns representing objects or things
They are always linked by attributes
They can only be abstract concepts
questions.answer: They are often nouns representing objects or things

questions.question: In the assignment example, which entity represents a unique identifier for a patient?
What relationship type exists between a doctor and a patient in the hospital example?
Which of the following is NOT a step in creating an ER diagram?
What is the purpose of debugging designs in ER modeling?
options: To ensure attributes are correctly linked
To plan queries and ensure all required data is represented
questions.answer: To plan queries and ensure all required data is represented
